fields.description:
Whenever I try to clone a Bitbucket repo I get an error because authentication failed. This started to happen a while ago. 

!image-2018-02-07-11-52-33-954.png!

To reenable the account I have to go to "Edit Accounts...", click on the account, click on "Edit" and then on "Refresh OAuth Token". After these steps cloning works without a problem, at least for a little while.

I also periodically get a SourceTree login dialog popping up when SourceTree is running in the background.

I haven't changed my password recently or done anything that I think could cause this problem.

What I've already tried to fix it:
 * Remove and add Account
 * Completely reinstall SourceTree
 * Replacing SSH key
fields.summary: Clone repository: Bitbucket user authentication fails regularly

fields.description:
when creating remote bitbucket repository from sourcetree it would be nice to have the option of selecting in which project it is created. Currently it is always put inside user profile which is not ok in our case.

We have created project for every customer (easier management and better review) and repositories are now added to the projects from web interface. After adding repository we have to add it to sourcetree and that is kind of annoying since we do a lot of small projects.
fields.summary: Create repository in project

fields.description: Sometimes when I create a stash in SourceTree it instead of creating a stash it does a COMMIT with the message "no message" and PUSHES automatically to the remote. Attached are log file located here; %USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree.
fields.summary: SRCTR - Stashing local changes creates a new commit and pushes the changes to remote

fields.description:
I receive new update on text files that I've in tracking. As usually I copy these files in my folder (under git control). Normally SourceTree recognize the modified files and keet it in Uncommitted Changes, but with version 2.4.8.0, sometimes, SouceTree doesn't recognized the changed files (no uncommitted changes).

 

Please verify, thanks

 

Ruggero Scarano
fields.summary: Doesn't recognize modified files

fields.description: When trying to stage files for a Commit SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Crashes when trying to stage files in Commit
Installer - Clone a Bitbucket repository - Grammar

fields.description:
SourceTree use only text encoding settings specified in Options->General->Repo Settings->Default text encoding. And ignores option specified in git config [gui.encoding|https://git-scm.com/docs/git-config#git-config-guiencoding]

I've got 2 repos with different encodings, so I have to choose wich one will be shown normally and wich one not.
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores git config gui.encoding

fields.description:
Filter does not work when not hit word in pending files.

Then, All file are displayed. but Hang-up when meny files in the repository.

I need no auto change option, or work search.
fields.summary: Filter(search) does not work and hang-up

Installing and logging into your atlassian account stalls forever on corporate network.  No way to bypass and install license manually or identify what is wrong / what is failing and why.  Indicator just spins forever in webview during install process.

fields.description: Clone link doesn't work on Remote repositories page. Have to right click and select Clone from popup menu.
fields.summary: Clone link doesn't work on Remote Repositories page

fields.description: When I select Repository -> Checkout... I get a dialog to select which branch to checkout. This dialog has a Cancel button which is enabled but not working unless I select a branch.
fields.summary: Can't click Cancel button in Checkout repository dialog

fields.description:
I had previously setup a git repository integrated to subversion with git-svn.

The basic interaction to Subversion worked (push, pull, & fetch) in Sourcetree v2.3.5

After upgrading to Sourcetree v2.4.7, I get the following error when attempting to push committed changes:

The branch name is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: 
https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html
Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Cannot push to Subversion after upgrade to 2.4.7

fields.description:
We are connecting to a local Bitbucket server, that is also accessible outside our network.

We connect through https and our SSL certificate is linked to the domain name.

When adding a remote repository account, we select Bitbucket Server, enter our host URL ([https://domain.com:8333/bitbucket),] select HTTPS for the preferred protocol. Everything works fine and it lists the remote repositories.

 

After I close Sourcetree, I reopen it and attempt to access my remote repositories again. The Bitbucket server account shows a red circle with an X inside.

 

When I open up the account details, the Host URL has changed to http at the beginning and the domain name has changed to the internal IP address of our server.

 

So every time I open Bitbucket, I have to edit the account details and change them back to the fully qualified domain name with https at the beginning.
fields.summary: Remote Account Host URL Reverts to IP address

fields.description:
Using the Tree View when I select a folder to stage and I dropped in the Staged Files window all files are selected. The problem is when I try to select another file or folder to stage. All files that are selected and not visible will remain selected provoking conflicts or undesired behaviours.

If the user is not paying attention he can discard important files.
fields.summary: Files still selected even if we select another

fields.description:
When clicking 'Create Pull Request...' from a branch I get sent to Bitbucket with error message. 

Url is: https://bitbucket.org/blueskymedicalstaffing/bluesky/blueskymedicalstaffing/bluesky/pull-request/new?source=blueskymedicalstaffing/bluesky::Capture

!image-2018-03-15-12-06-00-894.png!

 

If I wack back the above Url above to [https://bitbucket.org/blueskymedicalstaffing/bluesky/blueskymedicalstaffing] I can see my repo in Bitbucket without logging in.
fields.summary: Can't Issue Pull Request

<setting name="BitbucketHostBaseUrl" serializeAs="String">

 </setting>
fields.summary: "Clone in SourceTree" button crashes SourceTree

fields.description: The font is too light. All of the buttons and menus look like there are disabled. I get sore eyes after looking at SourceTree for awhile. You have a font option for the diff window. Could you not have one for the rest of SourceTree? At least provide an option to use a darker font.
fields.summary: Font too light

fields.description:
* Select the head of a branch.
 * Perform a rebase of that branch or a commit --amend outside of SourceTree
 * Return to SourceTree and refresh
 * SouceTree now sits loading thousands of commits trying to find the last selected commit so it can display it again, even though that commit is no longer reachable.s
fields.summary: Refresh with a now unreachable commit selected causes thousands of commits to be loaded

fields.summary: SourceTree won't start in Windows 10 Pro

fields.description:
I've had this happen twice so I've personally verified it's a bug but on small repo I have not been able to repo. It repos on my larger repo. 

Effectively sometimes when I pick "Unstage Hunk" SourceTree deletes the file. It then gets an error that it can not access the file. Checking the folder and looking at permissions the owner appears as "...". Nothing will let me access or change ownership of the file. Logging out and Logging back the file disappears (as though some how the file has been deleted before but still showed up in dir listing/explorer etc...)  Fortunately the previous version of the file is recoverable from git but of course missing any unstaged hunks.

Sorry I'm new to this so if I'm setting this wrong here I'm sorry but given it's losing work it seemed important to mark as critical/high priority
fields.summary: When Clicking Unstage Hunk sometimes SourceTree DELETES THE FILE!

fields.description:
I must have switched git tool during a merge (from sourcetree to commandline). The merge has long been completed and pushed and all is good. But Souce Tree pretends the merge is still going on. Because the File Status still shows me the old merge commit message "Merge branch 'master' into ... <file list>".

Restarting SourceTree or removing and re-adding the repository does not change. None of my other git tools have a problem. 

Other repositories work fine in SourceTree. Something must be cached.
fields.summary: File Status stuck in merge commit window

fields.description: All of a sudden, the source tree app got crashed while a two different repos. were being cloned parallel.  However, one of the two successfully cloned
fields.summary: Source Tree app crashed while cloning a repo

fields.description: If a file has square brackets in the path, and you try to ignore it, it doesn't escape the square brackets
fields.summary: Source tree ignore UI doesn't escape [ character

fields.description:
I just updated Sourcetree to the latest version. Then I cloned the WordPress repository from GitHub ([https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress.git),] which it did successfully (although it said some kind of "template not found" error when I viewed the log). After cloning it opened the list of commits and then promptly crashed, giving me a BugSplat window. I've tried switching between the embedded and system git, I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling Sourcetree, I've tried cloning WordPress using the terminal and adding it into Sourcetree. Crashes every time.

If you can reproduce this problem then awesome, but if you need me to send some kind of error log just let me know where to find it.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Crashes when opening specific repository

fields.description:
If a confirmation message is shown in the portrait mode screen, and then later (even after restarts) a confirmation message is shown while SourceTree is on a landscape page, its off the screen.

 

This has the result of instead of showing a confirmation message, the window just locks up until escape is pressed.
fields.summary: Confirmation Messages are put off the screen in multiple monitor setup

fields.description:
After trying to login to sourcetree, shutting down firewall, adding various sites to my trusted sites, I really dont know what else to do

!image-2018-01-24-16-48-42-614.png!
fields.summary: Can't log in with Atlassian account in Sourcetree

fields.description:
After upgrading and using a Bitbucket URI to check out a branch, SourceTree has lost all previously used repo paths in the "Checkout Existing" dialog tab.

This seems to occur after upgrades, intermittently.
fields.summary: After upgrade, "Checkout Existing" dialog forgets all previously-used repos
Git - fatal: Unable to create '/path/my_project/.git/index.lock': File exists

fields.description:
I can't clone from url

ssh://git@192.168.3.xxx:22/Users/git/MyGit.git

It still possible on Android Studio using Git

 

In a previous I can do this.
fields.summary: Can't pull from git on MAC

fields.description:
This is a sugestion requesting that the tabs used for the repositories have their width based on the width of the characters in the repo name, not the current fixed width.

Here is my use case:  There are about of dozen or so repos that I need to bounce between, all with relatively short names. The width of the tabs is a constant (in this version of SourceTree), about 2x as wide as they need to be for my repo names. This causes the tabs to exceed the width of the window, so I need to scroll left/right in order to see all of my tabs, even on a maximized window.  If the tabs were only slightly wider than the text they contain, all tabs would fit in the window with no scrolling.  The attached screen shot shows the text width as a black bar, and the wasted space as red bars.

I would think this would be a fairly trivial change, but a descent productivity booster!

Thanks,

Carl
fields.summary: SourceTree Repository Tab Width

fields.description: Using + to add another repo from BitBucket. I see a red X by my account, after figuring out I must Edit my account to login, the red X goes away but I see no repos listed and search does nothing
fields.summary: Can't list Remote Repos in my BitBucket account

fields.description:
Background:

Windows 10 with three (3) identical resolution displays arranged horizontally

Scenario:
 # Maximize Sourcetree App on display when app window is slightly overlapping other displays
 # Double-click title/menu bar or use maximize button

Expected:

App window is maximized on the display for which the majority of the app window was located

Actual:

All displays:
 * Screen artifact appears on overlapped screen (see images)

Workaround:

None.

Notes:
 * Display resolution set to 1024x768 to reduce image size.
 * Borders drawn on screen captures to highlight display edges.
fields.summary: Maximize app window when app window overlaps displays causes visual artifact on overlapped display

fields.description:
Sourcetree supports adding multiple keys in ; separated string, but does not split that string into multiple keys.

see: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Sourcetree-dont-ask-me-for-ssh-keygen-passwords-when-i-create/qaq-p/692412?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic

sh.exe C:\Users\s.moderow\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow feature start gutschein
C:\Users\s.moderow\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow: line 115: /gitflow-shFlags: No such file or directory

Installed Sourcetree and started git flow yesterday with no problems. Today the above problem started, maybe after restart of windows?

fields.description:
Scenario:
 # Maximize Sourcetree App on display
 # Use mouse to restore App to previous size by dragging it from the title/menu bar

Expected:

App window is restored to previous size on the same display upon which it was maximized.

Actual:

Main display:
 * Working as expected

Display two (2):
 * Window is restored to previous size but snaps back to the main display.

Display three (3)
 * Working as expected

Workaround:

Use the restore button or double click the title/menu bar to achieve expected behavior.

Notes:
 * Display resolution set to 1024x768 to reduce image size.
 * Display 3 cropped from image as it was not relevant to this issue.
fields.summary: Drag maximized app window restores to incorrect display on 3 display system

fields.description:
*"Tools" -> "Options": "Authentication" tab.*

"add" button is missing for "authentication" tab with *german language* settings (only).
fields.summary: "add" button is missing for "authentication" tab with german language settings

fields.description:
HG allows tags with spaces in it. It was possible to create such tags in previous version, however now SourceTree shows error messages "Tag name is invalid" if I use spaces in the Tag Name field.

I still can add such tags manually via editing .hgtags, but it would be more convenient to add them via UI.
fields.summary: Cannot create a mercurial tag that contains spaces in it

fields.description:
When connected to a repository via SSH (password accepted, pulling works fine and everything), trying to add files which are locked yield in a misleading error message telling me the server refused the connection.
Checking the log shows that said locked file can't be accessed and there's nothing wrong with the connection, unlocking the file resolves the error.

"Access denied to x files" would be better as indicator for this.
fields.summary: Weird/Misleading error message

fields.description:
I want to open SourceTree per command line in the current repository.

If I run {{$env:LOCALAPPDATA\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe -f . status}} then SourceTree opens, but not in the current repository. 

If I run {{$env:LOCALAPPDATA\SourceTree\app-2.4.7\SourceTree.exe -f . status}} then SourceTree opens correctly with the current repository.

Since this is a Squirrel app, it is not feasible to use the hard path with the version. The Sourcetree start wrapper should route all command line parameters to the actual exe.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not honor command line parameters in Windows correctly

fields.description:
I do the following:
 # Add folder
 # Rename folder
 # Click Clone

When I then try to choose the "Local folder:" it still shows the "New folder" for that folder I just renamed and the cloned repository does not get put in any folder event though I choose that one.
fields.summary: Add folder, rename and then clone

fields.description: Am using Source Tree version 2.4.7.0. In Previous versions, they had an option for resolving the conflicts with external merge tool. But in this new version, no option is available to resolve the conflicts. To resolve the conflicts, we have open the file manually.
fields.summary: Launch External Merge Tool was not available in Source Tree version 2.4.7.0

fields.description:
The message we enter when we create a stash is the description, not a ref format branch name. When trying to create a stash with a description containing a space I get an error:

"The stash desc is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: 
https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html
Completed with errors, see above."

but git command git stash save "Server no log" works perfectly.
fields.summary: Stash description validation is wrong

fields.description:
After staging few files every file except first leaves selected in «Staged files» area even I select another file from unstaged files. But folder collapse removes sellection.

Screencast on Youtube: https://youtu.be/5F3IfiRQIR8
fields.summary: Remove selection from all staged files

fields.description:
Apparently you cannot add spaces to stash names anymore

Reproduce steps:
 * Change some code
 * Click the Stash button
 * Type in some words eg "This is my stash comment"
 * Error occurs:
 ** _The stash desc is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules:_ 
_https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html_
_Completed with errors, see above._
 *  Close error dialog

 * Click the Stash button again

 * Type in some words without spaces eg "This_is_my_stash_comment"
 * Stash is successful.
fields.summary: Stash name is invalid (doesn't allow spaces)

fields.description:
The sidebar is a "tree" style UI element – it would be lovely if it could respect the usual keyboard shortcuts that trees have, especially left and right arrows.

Say I have a feature branch selected (a leaf node, under "BRANCHES" then "feature") – hitting left arrow 3 times should jump focus to the parent ("feature"), then collapse that node, then jump focus to "BRANCHES".
h2. Motivation

This is how keyboard navigation works in file explorers everywhere I can think of... it'd be a great help in sourceforge, because currently I have to switch to the mouse and just scroll for sometimes a long time (...we have a lot of tags), or drag the scrollbar... both are slow & fiddly.
h2. Actual behavior

Left and right arrow keys are ignored while focus is in the sidebar
h2. Desired behavior (based on type of node in focus)

*left-arrow*:
 * If the focus is on a leaf node: move focus to the parent node
 * If the focus is on an _expanded_ parent node, collapse it
 * If the focus is on a _collapsed_ parent node, move focus to the parent of the current node.

*right-arrow*:
 * If the focus is on a collapsed parent node: expand it
 * If the focus is on an expanded parent node, move to the first child node.

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Sidebar tree basic keyboard navigation: right/left arrows

fields.description: When attempting to use stash, I am no longer able to enter a sentence with blank characters in it into the comment field. Why?
fields.summary: Stash comments with blanks are no longer allowed. Why?

fields.description: When I open the tab for one specific git repository in sourcetree, it starts spawning as many as a hundred child processes: console window host, git for windows (32 bit) and sh.exe (32 bit). This causes the antimalware service executable to go nuts and saturate the cpu usage to 100%. In sourcetree itself, there is a loading bar at the top of the left sidebar that doesn't go away. Switching to the tab for a different git repository causes all the child processes to go away and the cpu usage goes back to normal. Pretty sure it only started after updating from 2.3.5.0.
fields.summary: Sourcetree is spawning tonnes of child processes when a specific git repository is open

fields.description: When a merge results in a conflict in a submodule, then this submodule is not shown in left pane. I used the submodule in the left pane to navigate to submodule with the conflict to resolve the conflict. Now I have to open the submodule by opening a new tab and then I can either use a bookmark or I have to look for submodule on my system.
fields.summary: submodule not visible in left pane when merge resulted in submodule conflict

fields.description: If I have a minified CSS file for example at only 176kb it causes Source Tree to crash every time. I have submitted numerous error reports relating to this. The un-minified version at only 2kb less does not cause the same issue.
fields.summary: Consistent Crashing on repositories that contain minified files with changes

fields.description:
h3. Behavior in Google Chrome:
 # Navigate to the repository in Bitbucket Cloud
 # Click the Clone action
 # Click "Clone in SourceTree"
 # Chrome starts SourceTree but it crashes

 

In the sourcetree log there are two types of exceptions.

Source tree takes forever to refresh

fields.description:
We are working with several tags that are automatically created/removed by Bamboo into the repo. The problem is that even several tags are being deleted, they get back whenever someone is doing a push through SourceTree. We found out that there is an option ("Push all tags to remote") that is set to true by default. This is creating a lot of issues in the repo, and it seems that even if it's set to false, after an update of SourceTree, this option is set to true again. This makes it really hard to even know who has this option enabled (as tags do not track who pushed them). Please make this option set to false by default (and keep users selection after a SourceTree update as well).

Thank you.
fields.summary: Disable push tags by default

fields.description:
I have somehow ended up in a problematic situation where I need to perform "git lfs migrate import" to fix an incorrect dirty state "git Encountered file(s) that should have been pointers, but weren't"

 

But the git terminal does not recognize any git lfs commands.

Using the embedded git, which was up-to-date but I updated again just in case.

 

Have tested this again in a repo which is working fine (no problems with dirty state)
Checkout with LFS works ok

Terminal does not recognize lfs at all.

 

Steps to reproduce:

check out repository that uses git-lfs

lfs files are checked out correctly

open terminal

type "git lfs version"

"git: 'lfs' is not a git command. See 'git --help'."

 

Also tried a command "git checkout --force" which fails, even though git-lfs is not explicitly mentioned, git refuses to work because of the lfs hooks
fields.summary: Git LFS not recognized in terminal

fields.description:
When doing a pull for a repo , when updating submodules the only options seen are as below .

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive

Update to include the "–remote" option as well 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive --remote

 

This helps to pull latest from remote branch as described in the .gitmodules file.

As of today it always updates submodules based on the commit when the submodule was linked and not on latest of a branch we need.
fields.summary: Git submodules update to latest on a remote branch

fields.description:
In earlier versions you could enter spaces in the branch name, and SourceTree would replace them with underscores automatically. This feature was really helpful, because I usually copy the name of the backlog item to use as the branch name.

The new version validates input of new branch name directly, so now I can do this anymore. I have to manually replace all spaces with underscores, and that it a bit annoying.

Can you please include space as a valid character, even if it really isn't, and do the underscore replacement as before?

(see attached pic)

This is because its showing both the name of the branch and the description. We can fix the local name by just deleting the description but have no way to do that for the source. I will attach a jpg of that too.

Finally, the cancel button in that dialog button does nothing so we have to exit source tree to get the dialog to go away.

fields.description:
We use VSTS to host our repo and to manage our bugs/work items. The way VSTS links commits to work items is by looking for the work item ID in the commit message, prefixed by the pound sign, like #12345..

It's not rare that I forget to add the ID or start to commit code before I even know the ID. I want to use Sourcetree's "Interactive Rebase" dialog to fix the commit messages for each commit in my branch but it does not handle the pound sign well. It simply deletes the rest of the message line after the pound sign or even aborts the rebase with an error.

Git itself has a similar problem when doing the interactive rebase via text editor, but it has a work around to make the rebase stop and give me a chance to --amend and then --continue the rebase. 

Clearly that's not very convenient. I much rather do everything in Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase and pound signs

fields.description:
The embedded version of [Git LFS|https://git-lfs.github.com] used in Sourcetree for Windows was vulnerable to CVE-2017-17831. An attacker can exploit this issue if they can commit to a git repository linked in Sourcetree for Windows by adding a .lfsconfig file containing a malicious lfs url, allowing them to execute arbitrary code on systems running a vulnerable version of Sourcetree for Windows.  This vulnerability can also be triggered from a web page through the use of the Sourcetree URI handler.


*Affected versions:*
* Versions of Sourcetree for Windows starting with 1.7.0 before version 2.4.7.0 are affected by this vulnerability.


*Fix:*
* Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 2.4.7.0 or higher from https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/ .

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lIIyO].
fields.summary: Git LFS: Arbitrary command execution in repositories with Git LFS enabled - CVE-2017-17831

fields.description:

It would be great to have a UI in Sourcetree for this feature.

fields.summary: Clicking 'Create Pull Request' gives an error about remote project configuration

fields.description:
The embedded version of Mercurial used in Sourcetree for Windows was vulnerable to CVE-2017-17458. An attacker can exploit this issue if they can commit to a Mercurial repository linked in Sourcetree for Windows by adding a git subrepository specifying arbitrary code in the form of a .git/hooks/post-update script, allowing the attacker to execute arbitrary code on systems running a vulnerable version of Sourcetree for Windows. 
 Sourcetree for Windows performs background indexing which allows for this issue to be exploited without a user needing to directly interact with the git subrepository. From version 1.4.0 of Sourcetree for Windows, this vulnerability can be triggered from a webpage through the use of the Sourcetree URI handler.

*Affected versions:*
 * Versions of Sourcetree for Windows starting with 0.5.1.0 before version 2.4.7.0 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 2.4.7.0 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/] .

*Acknowledgements*
 Atlassian would like to credit Zhang Tianqi @ Tophant for reporting this issue to us.

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lIIyO].
fields.summary: Mercurial: arbitrary command execution in mercurial repositories with a git submodule  - CVE-2017-17458

fields.description:
Sourcetree for Windows had several argument and command injection bugs in Mercurial and Git repository handling. An attacker with permission to commit to a repository linked in Sourcetree for Windows is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system. From version 0.8.4b of Sourcetree for Windows, this vulnerability can be triggered from a webpage through the use of the Sourcetree URI handler.

*Affected versions:*
 * Versions of Sourcetree for Windows starting with 0.5.1.0 before version 2.4.7.0 are affected by this vulnerability

*Fix:*
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 2.4.7.0 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/] .

*Acknowledgements*
 Atlassian would like to credit Zhang Tianqi @ Tophant for reporting this issue to us.

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lIIyO].
fields.summary: Various argument and command injection issues - CVE-2017-14593

fields.description:
Sourcetree currently cannot connect to an already running ssh-agent, it always starts its own ssh-agent.

 

If e.g. your Bitbucket Server is behind another host and you connect to it with SSH, you need to use a proxy jump host like this:

 

Host bitbucket.company.domain

  User git

  ProxyJump sshproxy.company.domain

  IdentityFile ~/.ssh/bitbucket

 

Host sshproxy.company.domain

  User USERNAME

  IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa

 

This works really well with GNU/Linux and with Windows using OpenSSH. For key management however we use PuTTY and pageant on Windows. Git comes with a ssh-pageant.exe and a start-ssh-pageant.bat script to launch the ssh-pageant.exe which talks OpenSSH to git but fetches the keys from PuTTY's pageant.

 

This works perfectly with TortoiseGit and Git for Windows, but it fails with Sourcetree because Sourcetree insists in launching its own ssh-agent instead of using the one already running.

 

Sourcetree should respect an already running ssh-agent/ssh-pageant and use the respective SSH_AUTH_* variables to connect to it.
fields.summary: Sourcetree connecting to already running ssh-agent

fields.description:

It causes the button action to change from 'Stage hunk' to 'Stage lines' and then you have to remove the selection to be able to stage the hunk again.

The same issue happens if you're just checking file modifications on Log/History tab.

How to reproduce #1:
 # Clone a repository
 # Make a file change
 # Open SourceTree, File Status tab
 # Select the modified file
 # Press the horizontal scrollbar

How to reproduce #2:
 # Clone a repository
 # Make a file change
 # Open SourceTree, Log / History tab
 # Select any commit
 # Select any modified file of the commit
 # Click on the horizontal scrollbar of any of the hunks

Then nothing happens.

To see what should happen:

 * Click the title bar, hold the mousebutton down and move the mouse.
fields.summary: Maximized SourceTree window is not draggable.
